SUMMARY: AlpA is a transcriptional regulator of intA expression [7511582]. It is part of CP4-57 cryptic prophage that is similar to bacteriophage P4 [7511583]. alpA was first identified as a multicopy suppressor of lon mutants that leads to expression of an alternative Lon protease activity named Alp [2656652, 7511582]. AlpA expression leads to increased synsis of IntA, which results in excision of CP4-57 cryptic prophage. excision inactivates gene upstream of intA, ssrA, encoding tmRNA [7511583]. Expression of alpA increases 6.5-fold upon deletion of tqsA; alpA expression may thus be involved in biofilm formation [16385049]. CP4-57: cryptic P4-like prophage at min 57 [7511583]. AlpA: alternative Lon protease [2656652].
